headline: ServiceNow (NOW) Q4 2025 Earnings Call Transcript
summary: Darren Yip: Good afternoon, and thank you for joining ServiceNow's fourth quarter 2025 earnings conference call. headline: ServiceNow AI Partnerships With Anthropic And OpenAI Underpin Undervalued Shares
summary: ServiceNow (NYSE:NOW) is deepening its AI partnerships with Anthropic and OpenAI to embed Claude and other advanced models into core enterprise workflows. The company is rolling out new AI driven workflows and industry solutions at enterprise scale, including new deployments with customers such as Panasonic Avionics and Fiserv. Management reports early results that include shorter implementation and preparation times for employees and customers using these AI capabilities. For investors...

headline: US software stocks slide after SAP, ServiceNow results fuel AI disruption fears
summary: U.S. software stocks fell on Thursday after SAP's cautious cloud outlook and a post-earnings drop in ServiceNow ​shares reinforced investor concerns about mounting competition from artificial intelligence-related ‌companies.  ServiceNow dropped 9.6% despite forecasting annual subscription revenue above Wall Street estimates.  The double-whammy dragged Salesforce shares down 5.6%, while Photoshop maker Adobe and ‍cloud security firm Datadog fell 3.1% each.

content.title: US software stocks slide after SAP, ServiceNow results fuel AI disruption fears
content.summary: U.S. software stocks fell on Thursday after SAP's cautious cloud outlook and a post-earnings drop in ServiceNow ​shares reinforced investor concerns about mounting competition from artificial intelligence-related ‌companies.  ServiceNow dropped 9.6% despite forecasting annual subscription revenue above Wall Street estimates.  The double-whammy dragged Salesforce shares down 5.6%, while Photoshop maker Adobe and ‍cloud security firm Datadog fell 3.1% each.

headline: ServiceNow Earnings Beat Estimates. Why the Software Stock Is Tumbling.
summary: ServiceNow  can’t catch a break.  The software company’s earnings report beat expectations but investors are shunning the sector and still look wary of its acquisition strategy, sending shares lower early Thursday.  ServiceNow delivered better-than-expected quarterly results and an upbeat outlook in its earnings after the market close on Wednesday.

content.title: ServiceNow Earnings Beat Estimates. Why the Software Stock Is Tumbling.
content.summary: ServiceNow  can’t catch a break.  The software company’s earnings report beat expectations but investors are shunning the sector and still look wary of its acquisition strategy, sending shares lower early Thursday.  ServiceNow delivered better-than-expected quarterly results and an upbeat outlook in its earnings after the market close on Wednesday.

headline: SAP Dives Amid Mixed Results As Key Cloud Metric Disappoints
summary: SAP stock plunged after the business software maker reported fourth quarter profit that topped estimates while revenue slightly missed.  A key cloud-computing-related metric for SAP stock came in below expectations.  "Current Cloud Backlog growth of 25% in constant currency was below target of 26%, driving shares lower," said TD Cowen analyst Derrick Wood in a report.

content.title: SAP Dives Amid Mixed Results As Key Cloud Metric Disappoints
content.summary: SAP stock plunged after the business software maker reported fourth quarter profit that topped estimates while revenue slightly missed.  A key cloud-computing-related metric for SAP stock came in below expectations.  "Current Cloud Backlog growth of 25% in constant currency was below target of 26%, driving shares lower," said TD Cowen analyst Derrick Wood in a report.

headline: Stock Market Today: Nasdaq Leads Sell-Off As Microsoft, ServiceNow Fall Hard; Oil Stock Rallies Past Entry (Live Coverage)
summary: The Dow Jones Industrial Average and other major stock indexes reversed from earlier gains and fell sharply Thursday, as Wall Street digested a slew of big earnings results.  Meta Platforms held strong gains, but Tesla reversed lower on the stock market today and Microsoft plunged on its results.  The Dow reversed for a 0.4% loss as Microsoft's 12% gash certainly weighed on blue chips.

Meta Platforms held strong gains, but Tesla reversed lower on the stock market today and Microsoft plunged on its results.  The Dow reversed for a 0.4% loss as Microsoft's 12% gash certainly weighed on blue chips.

headline: NOW Q4 Deep Dive: AI Platform Momentum and Strategic Acquisitions Shape Outlook
summary: Enterprise workflow automation company ServiceNow (NYSE:NOW) announced better-than-expected revenue in Q4 CY2025, with sales up 20.7% year on year to $3.57 billion. Its non-GAAP profit of $0.92 per share was 3.9% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

headline: ServiceNow (NOW) Stock Trades Down, Here Is Why
summary: Shares of enterprise workflow automation company ServiceNow (NYSE:NOW) fell 11.4% in the afternoon session after the company reported fourth quarter earnings: Current RPO (remaining performance obligations) was just in line with expectations, and it only narrowly topped analysts' revenue expectations.

content.title: ServiceNow (NOW) Stock Trades Down, Here Is Why
content.summary: Shares of enterprise workflow automation company ServiceNow (NYSE:NOW) fell 11.4% in the afternoon session after the company reported fourth quarter earnings: Current RPO (remaining performance obligations) was just in line with expectations, and it only narrowly topped analysts' revenue expectations.

headline: Wall Street Souring on Software
summary: ServiceNow, which reported earnings Wednesday afternoon, is down 11%.  The drop comes amid ServiceNow's recent streak of acquisitions, which have caused some concerns over whether the company's organic growth is slowing.  Cloud-software provider Salesforce was recently down about 8%—on pace for the largest percent decrease in nearly two years, according to Dow Jones Market Data.

content.title: Wall Street Souring on Software

The drop comes amid ServiceNow's recent streak of acquisitions, which have caused some concerns over whether the company's organic growth is slowing.  Cloud-software provider Salesforce was recently down about 8%—on pace for the largest percent decrease in nearly two years, according to Dow Jones Market Data.

headline: US software stocks slump as AI disruption fears take over
summary: U.S. software stocks fell on Thursday after SAP's underwhelming cloud outlook and a post-earnings slide in ServiceNow deepened concerns that traditional ​providers are being outpaced by artificial-intelligence players. Germany's SAP plunged more than 16% as analysts ‌flagged that its cloud backlog and 2026 revenue forecast fell short of projections. ServiceNow dropped 11% despite forecasting annual ‌subscription revenue above Wall Street estimates.

content.title: US software stocks slump as AI disruption fears take over
content.summary: U.S. software stocks fell on Thursday after SAP's underwhelming cloud outlook and a post-earnings slide in ServiceNow deepened concerns that traditional ​providers are being outpaced by artificial-intelligence players. Germany's SAP plunged more than 16% as analysts ‌flagged that its cloud backlog and 2026 revenue forecast fell short of projections. ServiceNow dropped 11% despite forecasting annual ‌subscription revenue above Wall Street estimates.

headline: Microsoft yanks Wall Street lower as gold's price suddenly snaps back
summary: The worst day for Microsoft in years is yanking the U.S. stock market away from its record heights on Thursday.  Microsoft was the heaviest weight on the market by far, and it tumbled 12% even though the tech giant reported stronger profit and revenue for the latest quarter than analysts expected.  Investors honed in instead on how much Microsoft is spending on investments, whether growth in its Azure cloud business will slow and how long its push into artificial-intelligence technology will take to turn into big profits.

content.title: Microsoft yanks Wall Street lower as gold's price suddenly snaps back
content.summary: The worst day for Microsoft in years is yanking the U.S. stock market away from its record heights on Thursday.  Microsoft was the heaviest weight on the market by far, and it tumbled 12% even though the tech giant reported stronger profit and revenue for the latest quarter than analysts expected.  Investors honed in instead on how much Microsoft is spending on investments, whether growth in its Azure cloud business will slow and how long its push into artificial-intelligence technology will take to turn into big profits.

headline: Stock Market Today: Nasdaq Down As Sellers Sting Microsoft, ServiceNow; Meta Up, BKV Breaks Out (Live Coverage)
summary: The Dow Jones Industrial Average and other major stock indexes reversed from earlier gains and fell sharply Thursday, as Wall Street digested a slew of big earnings results.  Meta Platforms soared, while Tesla dropped on the stock market today, and Microsoft plunged on its results.  After the market closes, all eyes are expected to shift to earnings from Apple.

headline: ServiceNow CEO Pushes Back on AI Fears
summary: ServiceNow beat expectations, but the stock still under pressure as Wall Street debates AI's impact on software. ServiceNow CEO Bill McDermott joined Bloomberg Open Interest to talk about on why his company says it's not being disrupted by AI it's leading it.

headline: Wall Street Sours on Software
summary: The rout underscores how fast Wall Street’s enthusiasm for the sector has evaporated in the months since the emergence of “vibe coding”—the practice of using AI tools to quickly produce apps and websites.  ServiceNow, which reported earnings Wednesday afternoon, is down 11%.  ServiceNow's recent streak of acquisitions have caused some concerns over whether the company's organic growth is slowing.

headline: Microsoft yanks Wall Street lower as gold's price swings sharply
summary: The worst day for Microsoft in years is yanking the U.S. stock market away from its record heights on Thursday.  Gold and silver prices meanwhile, are swinging sharply following their jaw-dropping runs.  Microsoft was the heaviest weight on the market by far, and it tumbled 12.1% even though the tech giant reported stronger profit and revenue for the latest quarter than analysts expected.

content.title: Microsoft yanks Wall Street lower as gold's price swings sharply

Gold and silver prices meanwhile, are swinging sharply following their jaw-dropping runs.  Microsoft was the heaviest weight on the market by far, and it tumbled 12.1% even though the tech giant reported stronger profit and revenue for the latest quarter than analysts expected.
